text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to advise the solicitor that cases like Palmer v R and Beckford v R are not binding domestic UK precedent since they are not UK-based. However, the candidate answer fails to include the required advice that these Privy Council cases are not binding domestic UK precedent (though they are highly persuasive).
